__Suppose that $\hat{g}$ is the ML estimate of a quantity $g$, and that  $\widehat{se}_{\hat{g}}$ is an estimated standard error. Show that a confidence interval for $g$, based on  $Z_{\log(\hat{g})}=[\log(\hat{g}) - \log(g)]/\widehat{se}_{\log(\hat{g})} \overset{\cdot}{\sim} NOR(0,1)$ has the form $[ \underset{\sim}{g}, \quad \overset{\sim}{g}]= [\hat{g}/w, \quad \hat{g} \times w]$ where $w=\exp[z_{(1-\alpha/2)} \widehat{se}_{\hat{g}}  /\hat{g}]$.__
